intro: Matelea hatschbachii, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a fragrant scent to attract pollinators. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stems. The plant is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
